intro: Isachne dispar, commonly known as the narrowleaf isachne, is a grass species native to temperate regions of Asia and North America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in width. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences, with each spikelet containing two to three florets. Isachne dispar thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, meadows, and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of ecological studies in grassland and wetland ecosystems.
